page.title: 04Sheffield to Worksop Railway
page.content: The {Railway}which crosses our block was built by the{Manchester Sheffield {and Lincolnshire Railway Co}in the {1850s.}The station in{Shireoaks}was built the same time as the Railway. In{1899}the name became the{Great {Central Railway}then in{1923}it changed to the{London and North {Eastern Railway}and since{1948}it has been part of{British Railways.}Coal trains mostly use the railway for bringing{coal}from{Dinnington {Mine.}The track which comes from {Dinnington}was built by The{Great {Central and Midland Joint Railway about{80 years ago}and joins the main line at{Brancliffe Junction}where there is a{Great Central signal {box.}There are{15}trains to{Worksop and{15}to{Sheffield }that stop at {Shireoaks Monday}to{Saturday}but none on{Sunday.
